etymology.description: 石(石) (shí, "rock") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") = hand measuring rock -> 石 phonetic component for pronunciation -> 石 corrupted to 𲟁
etymology.interpretation: The combination of a hand measuring a rock underlies the concept of measuring or gauging, leading to its meanings related to degree and limit. Over time, the rock component served as a phonetic element, though it was corrupted into another form.

examples.chinese: 他度过了愉快的一天(他度過了愉快的一天)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dùguò le yúkuài de yītiān.

examples.chinese: 水的沸点是100度(水的沸點是100度)。
examples.pinyin: Shuǐ de fèidiǎn shì yībǎi dù.
examples.english: The boiling point of water is 100 degrees.

examples.chinese: 这次考试的难度很高(這次考試的難度很高)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì kǎoshì de nándù hěn gāo.
